field.name: E_COMMANDMAP_NOIMPL
field.defaultValue: Command Class does not implement an execute() method

field.name: E_CONTEXT_INJECTOR
field.defaultValue: The ContextBase does not specify a concrete IInjector. Please override the injector getter in your concrete or abstract Context.

field.name: E_CONTEXT_REFLECTOR
field.defaultValue: The ContextBase does not specify a concrete IReflector. Please override the reflector getter in your concrete or abstract Context.

field.name: E_CONTEXT_VIEW_OVR
field.defaultValue: Context contextView must only be set once

field.name: E_EVENTMAP_NOSNOOPING
field.defaultValue: Listening to the context eventDispatcher is not enabled for this EventMap

field.name: E_MEDIATORMAP_NOIMPL
field.defaultValue: Mediator Class does not implement IMediator

field.name: E_MEDIATORMAP_OVR
field.defaultValue: Mediator Class has already been mapped to a View Class in this context

field.name: removed
field.description:
Internal

In the case of deffered instantiation, onRemove might get called before onCreationComplete has fired. This here Bool helps us track that scenario.

field.name: viewComponent
field.description:
Internal

This Mediator's View Component - used by the RobotLegs MVCS framework internally. You should declare a dependency on a concrete view component in your implementation instead of working with this property

method.name: EventMap
method.description: Creates a new EventMap object
method.param: eventDispatcher An IEventDispatcher to treat as a bus

method.name: mapListener
method.description: The same as calling addEventListener directly on the EventDispatcher, but keeps a list of listeners for easy (usually automatic) removal.
method.param: type The Event type to listen for
eventClass Optional Event class for a stronger mapping. Defaults to starling.events.Event.

method.name: routeEventToListener
method.description: Event Handler

method.name: unmapListener
method.description: The same as calling removeEventListener directly on the EventDispatcher, but updates our local list of listeners.
method.param: eventClass Optional Event class for a stronger mapping. Defaults to starling.events.Event.

method.name: unmapListeners
method.description: Removes all listeners registered through mapListener

method.name: CommandMap
method.description: Creates a new CommandMap object
method.param: injector An IInjector to use for this context
reflector An IReflector to use for this context

method.name: detain
method.description: Detain a Command instance
method.param: command The Command instance to detain

method.name: execute
method.description:
Execute a Command with an optional payload

The commandClass must implement an execute() method
method.param: commandClass The Class to instantiate - must have an execute() method
payloadClass An optional class to inject the payload as
named An optional name for the payload injection

method.name: hasEventCommand
method.description: Check if a Class has been mapped to an Event type
method.param: eventClass Optional Event class for a stronger mapping. Defaults to flash.events.Event.
method.return: Whether the Class is mapped to this Event type

method.name: mapEvent
method.description:
Map a Class to an Event type

The commandClass must implement an execute() method
method.param: eventType The Event type to listen for
commandClass The Class to instantiate - must have an execute() method

eventClass Optional Event class for a stronger mapping. Defaults to flash.events.Event. Your commandClass can optionally [Inject] a variable of this type to access the event that triggered the command.
oneshot Unmap the Class after execution?

method.name: release
method.description: Release a Command instance
method.param: command The Command instance to release for garbage collection

method.name: routeEventToCommand
method.description: Event Handler
method.param: commandClass The Class to construct and execute
oneshot Should this command mapping be removed after execution?
method.return: true if the event was routed to a Command and the Command was executed, false otherwise

method.name: unmapEvent
method.description: Unmap a Class to Event type mapping
method.param: eventClass Optional Event class for a stronger mapping. Defaults to flash.events.Event.

method.name: unmapEvents
method.description: Removes all mappings made through mapEvent

injectViewAs The explicit view Interface or Class that the mediator depends on OR an Array of such Interfaces/Classes.
autoCreate Automatically construct and register an instance of Class mediatorClass when an instance of Class viewClass is detected
autoRemove Automatically remove an instance of Class mediatorClass when its viewClass leaves the ancestory of the context view

method.name: classExtendsOrImplements
method.description: Does this class or class name implement this superclass or interface?

method.name: getClass
method.description: Get the class of this instance

method.name: getFQCN
method.description: Get the Fully Qualified Class Name of this instance, class name, or class
method.param: value The instance, class name, or class

method.name: createChild
method.description: Create an injector that inherits rules from its parent

method.name: getInstance
method.description: Create or retrieve an instance of the given class

method.name: hasMapping
method.description: Does a rule exist to satsify such a request?

method.name: injectInto
method.description:
Perform an injection into an object, satisfying all it's dependencies

The IInjector should throw an Error if it can't satisfy all dependencies of the injectee.
method.param: target The object to inject into - the Injectee

method.name: instantiate
method.description:
Create an object of the given class, supplying its dependencies as constructor parameters if the used DI solution has support for constructor injection

Adapters for DI solutions that don't support constructor injection should just create a new instance and perform setter and/ or method injection on that.

NOTE: This method will always create a new instance. If you need to retrieve an instance consider using getInstance

The IInjector should throw an Error if it can't satisfy all dependencies of the injectee.

method.name: mapClass
method.description:
When asked for an instance of the class whenAskedFor inject a new instance of instantiateClass.

This will create a new instance for each injection.
method.return: A reference to the rule for this injection. To be used with mapRule

method.name: mapRule
method.description:
When asked for an instance of the class whenAskedFor use rule useRule to determine the correct injection.

This will use whatever injection is set by the given injection rule as created using one of the other mapping methods.
method.param: useRule The rule to use for the injection
method.return: A reference to the rule for this injection. To be used with mapRule

method.name: mapSingletonOf
method.description:
When asked for an instance of the class whenAskedFor inject an instance of useSingletonOf.

This will create an instance on the first injection, but will re-use that instance for subsequent injections.
method.return: A reference to the rule for this injection. To be used with mapRule

method.name: mapSingleton
method.description:
When asked for an instance of the class whenAskedFor inject an instance of whenAskedFor.

This will create an instance on the first injection, but will re-use that instance for subsequent injections.
method.return: A reference to the rule for this injection. To be used with mapRule

method.name: mapValue
method.description:
When asked for an instance of the class whenAskedFor inject the instance useValue.

This is used to register an existing instance with the injector and treat it like a Singleton.
method.return: A reference to the rule for this injection. To be used with mapRule

method.name: unmap
method.description: Remove a rule from the injector

classRec.name: Actor
classRec.description:
Abstract MVCS IActor implementation

As part of the MVCS implementation the Actor provides core functionality to an applications various working parts.

Some possible uses for the Actor include, but are no means limited to:

  • Service classes
  • Model classes
  • Controller classes
  • Presentation model classes

Essentially any class where it might be advantageous to have basic dependency injection supplied is a candidate for extending Actor.

Event.name: startupComplete
Event.description:
Dispatched by the startup() method when it finishes executing.

One common pattern for application startup/bootstrapping makes use of the startupComplete event. In this pattern, you do the following:

  • Override the startup() method in your Context subclass and set up application mappings in your startup() override as you always do in Robotlegs.
  • Create commands that perform startup/bootstrapping operations such as loading the initial data, checking for application updates, etc.

  • Map those commands to the ContextEvent.STARTUP_COMPLETE event:

    commandMap.mapEvent(ContextEvent.STARTUP_COMPLETE, LoadInitialDataCommand, ContextEvent, true):
  • Dispatch the startupComplete (ContextEvent.STARTUP_COMPLETE) event from your startup() override. You can do this in one of two ways: dispatch the event yourself, or call super.startup(). (The Context class's startup() method dispatches the startupComplete event.)

method.name: Context
method.description:
Abstract Context Implementation

Extend this class to create a Framework or Application context
method.param: contextView The root view node of the context. The context will listen for ADDED_TO_STAGE events on this node
autoStartup Should this context automatically invoke it's startup method when it's contextView arrives on Stage?

method.name: mapInjections
method.description:
Injection Mapping Hook

Override this in your Framework context to change the default configuration

Beware of collisions in your container

method.name: shutdown
method.description:
The Startup Hook

Override this in your Application context

method.name: startup
method.description:
The Startup Hook

Override this in your Application context
method.event: startupComplete ContextEvent.STARTUP_COMPLETE Dispatched at the end of the startup() method's execution. This is often used to trigger startup/bootstrapping commands by wiring them to this event and calling super.startup() in the last line of your startup() override.
